results.adx_keywords: Search and Seizure;Classified Information and State Secrets;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.title: Republicans, Once Outraged by Mar-a-Lago Search, Become Quieter as Details Emerge
results.abstract: Some of former President Donald J. Trump’s most loyal allies were initially focused elsewhere — a potentially telling reaction with ramifications for his political future.

media.caption: From left, Eric Trump, Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia, Tucker Carlson, Donald Trump Jr. and former President Donald J. Trump at his golf club in Bedminster, N.J., last month. The former president’s allies have been largely silent after the release of the affidavit.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Espionage and Intelligence Services;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Central Intelligence Agency;National Security Agency
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and Mark Mazzetti
results.title: Classified Material on Human Intelligence Sources Helped Trigger Alarm
results.abstract: Documents related to the work of clandestine sources are some of the most sensitive and protected in the government. F.B.I. agents found some in boxes retrieved from Donald J. Trump’s home.

media.caption: Information from clandestine sources was included in some of the classified documents removed in January from Mar-a-Lago, former President Donald J. Trump’s home in Florida.
media.copyright: Josh Ritchie for The New York Times

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Espionage and Intelligence Services;Informers;United States Politics and Government;Political Prisoners;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;audio-neutral-informative;audio-negative-sad;Central Intelligence Agency;Afghanistan;China;Iran;Pakistan;Russia
results.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and Adam Goldman
results.title: Captured, Killed or Compromised: C.I.A. Admits to Losing Dozens of Informants
results.abstract: Counterintelligence officials said in a top secret cable to all stations and bases around the world that too many of the people it recruits from other countries to spy for the U.S. are being lost.

media.caption: Members of the Taliban at the former C.I.A. Eagle Base in Kabul in September. The agency has devoted much of its attention for the last two decades to terrorist threats and the conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq and Syria, but improving intelligence collection on adversaries like China and Russia is once again a centerpiece of its agenda.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.abstract: The government doesn’t get to pick and choose which documents to defend based on politics.

media.caption: Donald Trump at his golf course in Bedminster, N.J., in July.

results.title: DeSantis Suspends 4 Elected School Board Members After Report on Parkland
results.abstract: A grand jury report found the board members had engaged in “acts of incompetence and neglect of duty,” but an ousted member called the governor’s move “political retribution.”

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis’s decision to suspend four Broward County school board members was not unexpected because of a grand jury recommendation.
media.copyright: Luis Santana/Tampa Bay Times, via Associated Press

results.title: Possibility of Obstruction Looms Over Trump After Thwarted Efforts to Recover Documents
results.abstract: Unredacted portions of the affidavit underlying the Mar-a-Lago search warrant point to a crime that has been overshadowed amid disputes over classified information.
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

media.caption: The redacted affidavit, released on Friday by the Justice Department, includes references to possible obstruction.

results.adx_keywords: Tennis;Content Type: Personal Profile;United States Open (Tennis);Ovarian Cancer;Breast Cancer;Evert, Chris;Evert Dubin, Jeanne (1957-2020)
results.title: Chris Evert Needs Everyone to Listen
results.abstract: Since January, the 18-time Grand Slam champion has balanced her work in tennis with the grueling routine of chemotherapy for ovarian cancer. She never would have caught it early, if she hadn’t lost her sister to the same disease.

media.copyright: Melanie Metz for The New York Times

results.byline: By Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard
results.title: What You Need to Know About Biden’s Student Loan Forgiveness Plan
results.abstract: President Biden’s move means the student loan balances of millions of people could fall by as much as $20,000. This F.A.Q. explains how it will work.

media.caption: Queens College in Flushing. Not everyone with debt will qualify for the student loan forgiveness plan.
media.copyright: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Gave In to Pressure on Student Debt Relief After Months of Doubt
results.abstract: At the White House and aboard Air Force One, advocates of debt cancellation made a sustained push to win over the president, who feared the plan would be seen as a giveaway to the privileged.

media.caption: President Biden and Education Secretary Miguel A. Cardona announcing the student loan forgiveness plan this week. Mr. Biden agonized for months over the decision.

results.title: The Latest Find as Water Levels Fall: Dinosaur Tracks in Texas
results.abstract: Dinosaur Valley State Park is home to Acrocanthosaurus and Sauroposeidon tracks. The temporarily dry Paluxy River allowed researchers to discover more.

media.caption: Severe drought conditions at Dinosaur Valley State Park exposed dinosaur tracks that were previously hidden underneath the Paluxy River.

results.title: Doug Mastriano Wore a Confederate Uniform in a Faculty Photo
results.abstract: Mr. Mastriano, the Republican nominee for governor of Pennsylvania, is a state senator whose district includes Gettysburg.
